response_text: Yes — real-time audio-to-text (transcription) and translation exists and is widely available using AI. These tools can listen to spoken language and convert it into written text instantly — and some can even translate into a different language in real time. Speechlogger+2Xfyun+2 [https://speechlogger.com/]  Real-Time Audio → Text (Transcription)  Web apps and tools like Speechlogger can transcribe live speech into text instantly. Speechlogger [https://speechlogger.com/]  Platforms like 讯飞实时语音转写 and cloud services (Google, Azure, Alibaba Cloud) offer real-time speech-to-text APIs you can integrate into apps. Xfyun+1 [https://www.xfyun.cn/service/rtasr]  Browser/phone apps can also do live speech → text (e.g., voice typing extensions or dedicated apps). Chrome Web Store [https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/voice-in-speech-to-text-d/pjnefijmagpdjfhhkpljicbbpicelgko?hl=zh-CN]  Real-Time Audio → Text + Translation  Some services do transcription and translation on the fly, producing captions or translated text. Examples include Maestra.ai, Wordly, KUDO, and others supporting dozens of languages. Maestra+1 [https://live.maestra.ai/]  Devices That Do It Live  Certain earbuds and mobile apps can translate spoken language in real time as you listen.
